publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3802 Bill Kidd: Congratulations to the Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum Peer Education Programme—That the Parliament congratulates all those involved with the Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum Peer Education Programme on the publication of the first edition of its magazine, United, which is the exclusive creation of peer educators from Knightswood and St Thomas Aquinas secondary schools; recognises the forum’s peer education programme and the efforts of the peer educators themselves in teaching 11 to 16-year-old pupils about transition, peer pressure and substance misuse, and believes that this programme provides an inspirational example for other organisations in raising awareness of substance abuse and the issues with which it is related. Supported by: Christina McKelvie*, Jamie Hepburn*, Anne McLaughlin*, Robert Brown*, Bob Doris*, Bill Butler*
S3M-3802 Congratulations to the Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum Peer Education Programme (lodged on 25 March 2009) Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*
